text: How's it going today?
Oh, just another day in paradise! How about you?
So you're living in a paradise?
Oh, absolutely! Just me and the sunshine, living the dream. How can I help you escape reality today?
I don't know. Just have a chat with me, I guess.
Sure, let's chat! What's on your mind?
Not that much. Just doing some work and talking to you in the background.
Ah, multitasking like a pro! What kind of work are you doing?
Pharmacy. I'm a pharmacist working in a hospital verifying orders.
Sounds thrilling! Just you and a sea of medications.
That sounds right except I don't actually touch the medication. So I just use the computer verify.
Ah, the glamorous life of a computer clerk in a pharmacy! Must be thrilling.
I'm not a clerk. I'm a pharmacist.
Got it, you're the brains behind the operation! No mixing potions for you, just clicking buttons.
Yeah. Do you know how it works?
Sure, I know the basics. You verify prescriptions, check for interactions, and ensure accuracy. Pretty crucial stuff!
Yeah. Do you know what system I'm using?
Nope, I'm not a mind reader! What's the system?
Well, do you know the main systems that are used in hospitals?
Sure, there's Epic, Cerner, and Meditech. Take your pick!
I'm using
Looks like you forgot to finish that thought! What system are you using?
He's Using Epic.
Epic, huh? Fancy! Must be nice to have all that tech at your fingertips.
What do you know about Epic?
Oh, just that it's the go-to for hospitals. A real love-hate relationship, right?
Well, we is the most popular, Epic, Cerner, or Meditech?
Epic's like the rockstar of hospital systems. Cerner and Meditech are more like the backup band. Epic usually takes the spotlight in popularity!
Is it the most expensive?
Oh, absolutely! Epic's like the luxury car of EHRs.
Do you know the prices that hospitals pay?
Nope, I don't have a price list. But I hear it's like buying a mansion!
So millions
Yeah, millions. Quite the investment for a software, huh?
What language does it use?
Epic primarily uses a language called Cache ObjectScript, which is a bit specialized.
So is it made for epics, or is it a general language?
It's a general-purpose language, but tailored for healthcare. Not just for Epic!
What else is it using?
Oh, just some fancy tech like APIs and databases. You know, the usual hospital wizardry.
So it's used in hospitals exclusively?
Pretty much, unless you're in a very niche market.
Why do hospitals stick to one language?
Consistency, compatibility, and training efficiency. Plus, who doesn’t love a good vendor lock-in?
So you're saying there's no other languages that are suitable for hospitals? That's really weird.
Well, it's all about compatibility and integration. Hospitals like their systems to talk to each other without drama.
Use Python or c plus or something like that.
Sure, but Epic is a bit of a one-trick pony with its proprietary stuff. Python and C++ can do a lot, but they’re not the main act in the hospital world.
I'm just curious
Curiosity is great! Just don't get lost in the code jungle.
why do they use this language. No. I'm curious why this language the best. Why this one?
Because it's designed for healthcare. It’s like the Swiss Army knife of hospital software—versatile and tailored for the job!
How can a language a computer language be designed health care? It's just a database just like anything else.
Well, it's all about making sure the system can handle complex healthcare data while being user-friendly. Plus, it needs to comply with regulations. So, it's not just any database!
So the language itself has regulation
Yep, it's all about keeping things safe and compliant in healthcare. Who knew code could be so strict?
Give me an example.
How about HIPAA? It's all about keeping patient info safe.
Yeah. But how does the language
Well, it's all about compliance and safety. You know, making sure patient data is handled properly.
I still don't understand how the language contributes to it.
It's all about ensuring safety and compliance. The language helps structure data in a way that's easy to validate and follow regulations.
This is a pretty long conversation.
Well, welcome to the epic saga of Epic! Want to switch topics?
What's the weather like tomorrow?
Tomorrow's weather in Orlando? Expect sunny skies with a high near 87°F. Perfect for your outdoor plans, if you have any!
What's the current weather?
Currently, it's 62.6°F with a few clouds. Not too shabby for Orlando!
